Well, I paid for expedited shipping on this and got it very quickly. It is a nice costume, but be warned you will probably need to put A LOT of money or work into it:

1) There are no instructions for the straps. It took 2 people 3 hours to figure everything out. Very frustrating to put it nicely. Google pictures of the costume on other sites to see how the straps go.

2) I'm a big girl. Pear shaped probably size 16/18- a L on top XL on the bottom. I ordered a 1X based on the size chart just to be safe because I figured I could take it in. Well the shirt was about 3 sizes too big, and the zipper only stays up if you pull it all the way. If you want to show any cleavage you have to pin into place so you aren't X-rated. The shirt had to be rebuilt into a Baverian style shirt just so it wouldn't fall off me.  The corset was about 5 inches too big, and the skirt and leggings were about 1 size too big. The straps that go under the arm were 4 inches too long, the 2 belts were 2 sizes too big and the straps that go around the front were too short. Even the arm pieces were too big and had to be taken in. The straps that go across the back were sewn wrong (see pictures) it was supposed to be an x inside a square shape and mine would not lay flat no matter how hard we tried. Had to rip the stitches out and re-sew. There was a minor amount of tearing on the inside of the corset but since it was inside and I had bigger problems than that I let it go.

I had to pay $50 in TWO ROUNDS!! of alterations to get all this work done, which should have cost me $100 but because the girl felt bad for me that it was 10 days to Halloween and was a friend of a friend I got the work done in time for Halloween. You can see my picture of the finished product. Even with all the alterations I still had to safety pin the straps under the arm to shorten them and the straps that go over the chest to give me room for my bosom.

I am a big girl, I am more than ok with that. But even if I had ordered an XL to fir better all the straps would still be sewn wrong parts of the outfit were still too big. If you are a size 6 you can probably get a small or medium right off the rack and be ok. If you are like the rest of us normal fluffy girls be prepared to do some major work. I paid $140 for this and expected a lot better for the price. Will NOT buy from this seller again and considering asking for my alteration money back.
summary: It is a nice costume, but be warned you will probably need ...

These chiffon dresses with the matching ties are absolutely gorgeous dresses. There are two different colors of the dresses. One is a very pale pink. It's a very pale version of what I consider a ballet pink. The other is a fuschia pink. Both are made the same and are strapless dresses. These dresses have some added features that helps the top to stay up. First, they have a built in bra with a strap in the back so you can adjust the built in bra. They also have a rubber like strip across the top that will grip your skin so that the top stays up. We really put these dresses through the test and jumped up and down in them to see if they would fall down and they did not. The dresses are made from the softest material that moves and flows with your body. The dresses are very comfortable and appear to be well made. The top has layered material as does the bottom. They have a sash with them that could also be left off if you did not want to wear it. These dresses would be great for prom, bridesmaids, a photo shoot or just for a night out. I am very impressed with these dresses and for the price, I could not find a dress like this locally! They are absolutely gorgeous when on! Product provided as free promotional samples in exchange for my evaluation and my honest, unbiased review.

reviewText: fits all expectations

Let me start by saying I am a bigger girl, typically wearing a 3X top and size 24 or 26 pants.  I have a big boodie and stomach as well as wide hips, so I was not all that thrilled to be swimsuit shopping to begin with.  Considering my challenges, I was looking for a swimsuit that would cover as much as possible without wearing a full-body wetsuit.  LOL

I ordered this swimsuit in a Size 24.  The skirt is comfortable, stretchy and fit great!  The skirt goes just above the knee and hands down enough in the back that I am not horribly embarrassed.  This is saying A LOT for me.

The top is gorgeous in color, made from a good solid material and fits-ish.  In other words, the top "fits" but it was tight on my stomach area and made me very self-conscious.  The bra area has no support and leaves the girls sagging. The straps are not adjustable and they are too long.  The top pulls tight around my waist so it bunched up and tends to pull the skirt up with it.  I will keep it as a back up, but I found a better top with underwire and double layers in the stomach so it fits better and is MUCH more flattering.

Good luck on your swimsuit quests ladies!
summary: Half of this suit is amazing the other half is a thumbs down.

I'm 5' 2" a size 18, 40D. (I don't look like Marilyn Monroe in my photo, and I know should have sucked in my gut, but I'm including it in case it helps someone else my size to decide!) This set is a very good deal for the price. The shorts are comfy and have a sewn-in, full brief liner. They hit me mid-thigh. The leg openings don't bind when I sit down. The top is vibrantly colored, with sturdy, thick straps and built-in brassiere cups. The neckline is sporty and modest with no cleavage. The material is not exactly luxurious, but it's soft and not see-through. As someone else said, the top is a little smaller and narrower than I expected (especially compared to the shorts, which are generously sized.)  Would I wear this bathing suit  on a fancy cruise or to a stylish resort where I'd want to dress to impress? No. But this suit is perfect for my needs: casual hanging out and walking around at the beach with friends and family. I'm an active, plus-sized, middle-aged lady, so I'd rather the top be a little snug and supportive than floppy, anyway.
summary: The top is snug but overall, this is a good deal!

This bag exceeded my expectations in a couple aspects:

1.) Construction is very sturdy and has held a good deal of weight without any issue.
2.) I was originally concerned about the size of the bag and if it would hold enough. There is a ton of room to pack items in this bag, numerous pockets for organizing and it's easy to carry with the shoulder strap.

It had a very distinct smell when I first started using it, but after a couple trips it had gone away completely. I would highly recommend this bag for those looking to have a solid quality weekender at a very affordable price.

reviewText: My husband loves it. Fits as expected & good quality.

Ok, first of all this shirt looks amazing. The color and detail of the graphics are spot on. However, I ordered this for my husband who typically wears a 2XL in most shirts, and sometimes even a XL at that. I ordered a 2XL which is the biggest size they offered and it literally looked like a bra on him. There is no stretch at all to the material, which wouldn't be a problem if it fit as expected at least. I generally wear a medium or large in women's and a small in men's and this fit me comfortably, just a little big but not crazy big (in a 2XL). SO if you do order this shirt, because yes it's dope af, then order at least two sizes larger than you normally would, and if you wear a XL or bigger in most shirts I sadly wouldn't recommend this shirt for you. It did ship from China so patience is a virtue. It took about 3 weeks for it to arrive.
summary: LOOKS AWESOME but FITS VERRRYYYY SMALLLLL

reviewText:

When I asked the doctor, I was told that I can wear it, unless it's tight to the point that it causes pain.
It's made out from a very comfortable fabric. Still a little heavy, may be that's why it keeps me pretty warm as well. At home, I don't need to wear anything on top of it.

reviewText: I wanted a nice comfortable piece of clothing for post mastectomy.  This definitely was comfortable but as soon as I was done with my drains (about a week) I was done with this. reviewText:
So far so good!  The quality of this belt seems very good for the price and it works pretty well once you get used to it.  To unbuckle, however is a little hard on the finger when you have to push the release button, but I'm getting used to it.  Overall I recommend assuming it holds up over time.
Update to this review.  I have had this belt 1.5 years and the belt strap has begun to split in the back.  The buckle works better than the initial review, but I'm a bit disappointed that the belt strap failed so soon.  Since the one year warranty has expired, I was forced to order another belt with buckle and, supposedly, with a note to the seller, they will credit me the $6 buckle and send only the strap.  Rating changed from four stars to three stars.
summary: Nice Belt for the Price, but....

reviewText:
I think this is pretty cute and attractive for a nursing bra, and for me it has worked well.  The bra opens very easily with the snap closures. I would suggest that you be careful when opening and closing the snaps, because I was a little rough on mine and one of the snaps started to rip off. I caught it in time and repaired it with needle and white thread and it's still working fine, but if you rip out one of the closures, it won't be of any use to you.
The bra ships with a small extender piece which can make the size a little larger if you find it doesn't fit for you. For me, it was true to size. The straps all around are fairly wide. This is great for comfort and support. The only time it's problematic is if you are trying to wear a tank or a shirt with spaghetti straps, it's possible that the wide shoulder straps will show through. Also, it doesn't look great under a thin white shirt because of the black piping.
Some people mentioned that there's not enough support/coverage; Well, I am normally a smaller sized chest, so when breastfeeding I am not overly large which might be the case for other women who have naturally larger bosoms. I can only speak for myself; it's working well for me.
However, on balance, it's a comfortable, practical and cute bra for nursing mommies.
summary: A comfortable, practice, and cute bra for nursing mommies

reviewText: Its perfect and very comfortable. I Highly recommend it. I've been lucky enough to breastfeed 3 babies. Now, finally, with my third baby I found the perfect nursing bra. I wish this would have been around when I had my first baby. It is truly comfortable and is easy to use. I can wear it during the day and can sleep comfortably at night with it too.
summary: Its the best nursing bar ever.

reviewText:
I have ordered at least 10 Dooney and Bourke purses from Ilovedooney ( through Amazon) I have only sent back one item--a wristlet that I did not like the zipper on. I had no problem with the return.
Let me tell you this Kendall bag is really the cutest bucket I've seen. I'm a purple gal and the aubergine is a nice color-- understated but undeniably purple.  The size is great for me. I don't like to carry a lot of stuff but I do need to carry the usual -- wallet, keys, large cell phone -- and I find that a small bag doesn't always cut it . But this one does hold my stuff without being too heavy. I love that it's a crossbody. Of course it can be adjusted to a shoulder strap if that's what you like. The pebble leather on this seems a tad bit more supple than my other Dooneys and that is a nice plus. The bag came with all the straps wrapped and was nicely stuffed with tissue. It came with a dust cover and registration card.
Bottom line is I love this bag!  And I love Ilovedooney! Be sure to watch their website as, aside from their usual markdowns, they periodically run some truly amazing deals.

5 Stars: EXCELLENT!!! The product met and exceeded all of my expectations. Nothing needs improvement. Highly recommended.
4 Stars: Met most, but not all of my expectations. There is at least one little thing I do not like or needs improvement.
3 Stars: Average/Good. The product gets the job done, but barely meets my expectations. Not great. Something or a few things need improvement.
2 Stars: Don't bother wasting your time or money. The product does not meet the designed purpose.
1 Star: Forget it! It is a complete failure and was a complete waste of money! Go find another product. This one is Garbage!

This is a really nice and unique bracelet.  The combination of the feminine lace, pearls, and flower with the more edgy winged skull and chain gives it a tough yet soft look. The lace and skull are high quality while the chain, beads, and ring are standard costume jewelry quality which are consistent with quality expected at this price point. My 2 year old daughter got ahold of the package when it arrived and when I opened the package the flower had detached from the ring. It was an easy fix but it made me more aware of the possibility of it detaching with enough force.  My fingers are a bit on the chubby side so I appreciated the adjustable band on the ring. The adjustable chain and clasp bracelet closure make this bracelet able to be worn by a variety of wrist sizes. The chain that attaches the bracelet to the ring is a generous length that doesn't restrict movement. I think this bracelet is a great statement piece that would compliment many outfits. I received this item for a discounted price in exchange for my unbiased review.

This is a very pretty and fun bracelet. I like the lace. You can adjust it for smaller and larger wrists. The skull and wings are well made and not made out of bendable metal, unless you put quite a bit of force into it. The ring is well made. It is an adjustable ring. The chains are a little on the delicate side and probably would not stand up to very much force so I will be careful with that part of it. If you are looking for something fun to dress up and outfit a little this would work for you. I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Pros
Cute
Fun
Metal doesn't bend

Cons
Chain is a little on the flimsy side

The lace part of this bracelet is approx 5 inches long with an extender chain of approx 2.5 inches. No matter if your wrist is small or large, you shouldn't have an issue with fit. The lace is not scratchy at all, it is soft against the skin. There are 6 pearls, and a center charm of a skull with wings on either side which is approx 2.5 inches long. The ends of the wings are anchored down so they don't flap around. The white chain is approx 4 inches and connects to a white plastic rose on an adjustable ring. My middle finger is a size 7.5/8 ring and the adjustable ring fits perfectly with no adjustment but there is room to make smaller or larger to fit your finger.

Such a great statement piece for a small amount of money. I'm very pleased with this bracelet and can't wait to see what else the seller has to offer! I was given this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review.

There is a learning curve to ordering from these made in china sellers on Amazon. Once you figure it out, you find some gems.

I'm about 5'7" 180 lbs, less than 10% body fat. I have huge shoulders and chest. Not to brag, but that's just the way it is. The drop between my chest size and my waist size is about 12 inches. So I have the hardest time finding clothes that fit right off the rack. Slim fit usually is too slim to get over my shoulders even though my belly is tiny, and regular fit looks like a dress on me.

I bought about 6 of these shirts in every color in the Asia L (US S) and they fit like a glove. Especially the length. They go slightly beyond my waist which is what I'm looking for. Usually guys with my shoulder and chest size are much taller so shirts are usually much longer.

The downside is that the buttons pop off easily when washed. My solution was just to rip all of them off to look uniform. It works.

I got this for the extra wide brim and the SNAP closure.  I find the velcro that almost all hats have very annoying and it keeps getting my hair, so I thought this is it!

Sadly, it was very uncomfortable.  I got a headache within 10 minutes of wearing it.  It has no give and when I loosen it up so that it doesn't give me a headache it just slips off, and when it's snug and doesn't slip off it's uncomfortable.

Then again, everyone's head is different, so it may work for others.  I bought a bunch of hats on Amazon (yay free returns) to see which would work best.  The SunGrubbies went back, and so did the Wallaroo Sun Visor (not wide enough brim, but I liked the construction!).  I ended up keeping the cushees (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BWUF22I/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_10) and the Scala (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00OWAB5RQ/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_15).  Sadly, both have velcro, but they have also material that is just a tad elastic so that it is more comfortable (again, for my own head).

Hope this helps!
summary: loved the snap closure and wide brim, but uncomfortable

This dress is so, so gorgeous. And at under $30, could it get any better? I've seen this same style of dress for over $100 on other sites. I was pretty amazed when I found it here!
I am about 5'4" and 110 pounds and I ordered a small. The top was a bit loose since my chest is a bit on the smaller size. You might need a plunge bra with this dress; for me, the neckline did go lower than a normal bra, but it would have been fine if I had adjusted the straps to be slightly shorter. As previous reviewers have said, the dress is EXTREMELY long. I wore 5 inch heels with it and it was still about 9 inches too long! It was totally fine after hemming, which wasn't too difficult since the material is a thin chiffon. It is interesting to note that the bottom of the dress was not completely symmetrical before I had it cut. I think the sides were an inch or two longer than the front and back.
Also, the slip underneath is pretty short so you might need a longer slip or some extra fabric!
Overall, this is a very beautiful dress, and a wonderful price. If you are willing to put a little extra effort so that it'll fit you perfectly, then this is the dress for you!
summary: Gorgeous dress, will likely need alterations

This briefcase is a synthetic material, Polypropylene, but it feels very soft and leather like and it could probably be used as a simply styled purse. The dimensions are 11.4 x 2.4 x 12.2 inches (LxWxH). It's smaller than most of Avber's other briefcases, but then if you're like me, you're probably carrying a lot less paper than you did years ago. So many things like brochures, product analysis sheets and supporting documents are produced electronically and traded or supplied that way. I'm not stuffing nearly as much into a belief case these days beyond an iPad or other tablet, business cards and maybe just a few documents. I don't really need to be carrying a huge briefcase. My iPad Mini fits as well as another brand of 10 inch tablet in a case. There's one huge advantage to this size case when traveling in the summer when it's often too hot to leave a tablet in the hot trunk of a car when going to lunch: This a manageable size to bring into a restaurant without it looking too bulky. This is sized more like a large-ish purse and is much more compact.

Although this is shown as a man's case, I think it looks more like a woman's style. I asked my husband, and he agrees. It could probably go either way though. It would probably depend on the man and his industry.

It has an outside zilppered pocket that could be used for a cellphone, pens and pencils or business cards, among other ideas. It is lined in brown fabric which goes with the light brown trim on the outside. It has two sections on the inside, plus one zipped pocket and one small open slot or pocket, perhaps for business cards. It has a detachable shoulder strap which I think is a big plus. I'll attach some photos so you can see it.
A sample less provide for testing and review.

Update 5/25/15 - well, my husband has decided that this looks like a man's briefcase after all and he has decided that he wants to use it. (But it's nice for either a man or woman. It's a nice size.)
summary: Lovely business style briefcase that could also be used as a purse

reviewText:
I absolutely LOVE THIS! I love how it fits! I am always wary of 1size, but this is perfect on me. I'm 5'5", 185. It almost goes to the floor. It is revealing, but still covers certain parts (if you want it to). I really want to wear it with some heels, maybe put a G-string underneath, wear a necklace & earrings, and do up my hair. That's how this makes me feel. This has quickly become my favorite piece I own so far out of about a dozen pieces. My boyfriend says it's yummy & I haven't dressed it up for him yet.
One tiny thing I don't like are the straps. 2 attached to the front and 2 to the back. I kinda want to just use the front ones to make a halter type tie. I might cut off the back ones. I guess I could tie front to back or whatever configuration I come up with.
I was fortunate enough to receive a discount for this product in exchange for an honest review. You can see by my other reviews that they are not glowing reviews like this one. I really do love this product!

When I pulled it out of the package I thought,  no way!  It fit amazingly well.  It had jaw dropping results!  The only thing I was a bit down hearted about is that the shoulders tie.  But in the end, just made it easier to slip out of.  I am a size US 10.  So, I am not tiny, but I guess close to average.  It was soft , but softer after washing and even silkier.

When I ordered this I was a little afraid it would be too constricting in the legs and I wouldn't be able to sleep with it on. However, after trying it on I can tell you it is very stretchy and plenty comfortable. One thing I didn't notice before buying it was that the straps tie together in the back. Not a big deal, but just something of note. It could be possible to change up the way the straps sit, like to maybe cross them in the back instead. The material on this seems to be good quality with no tears or loose threads. It fits accurate to the picture. Based on how stretchy it is I think it could accommodate a range of varying shapes and sizes. Note: I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

The above selection for "fit as expected" does not do this gown justice. All too often, I ordered what looks like a nice gown and it is either tee tiny to wear or ,if stretchable for curves, it is often flimsy material that runs at a touch. This one is absolutely beautiful! I am still battling the baby bod after our toddler's birth and am trying to keep my confidence going and this was such a boost. One size fits all is often a scary statement, but I do think this piece could be complimentary to most shapes, if not all. The material is extremely soft and comfortable and grabs all of the right curves without clinging insultingly. It moves with you amazingly and shifts in a way that makes you feel....sultry, I think is the word I am looking for. It may sound odd, but seeing myself in this gown made my night and I truly believe it will be doing the same for husband as well! ;)
summary: Beautiful, sultry gown! Amazing fit for most shapes and great quality!

If you tilted the watch side to side they shifted .02" (.50mm) forward or backward. This is a deal breaker for me. A watches movements should be solid. Excess backlash in the movement will progressively get worse from impact/shock during normal wearing. Another issue unrelated to the defect is the length of the wrist straps. They are too short for a watch this size. They are at least an 1" shorter than the ones on my G-Shock. I could only engage the 3rd to last hole for it to fit comfortably. The excess strap barely fits into the securing loop on the opposite strap and looked weird because it was so short.

Ratchet belts are one of those ideas that was LONG over due. What took them so long?!!?  I buy cars with power seats not because I'm lazy, but I really like how a power seat can be put in more positions.  The same with the ratchet belt - I really like how it 'ratchets' to more lengths than a belt with holes - and the holes are seldom in the length I really want..
I got this particular belt because I like the colors and the style - not to plain and not to fancy.
The leather of the belt is a nice thickness - it seems like it will be durable.  But it does have 3 layers, and can't tell what the middle (thickest) layer is.
Have to take a star off for the instructions, which don't even tell u how to take it off!!  I put it on when I opened it, and got a bit scared when  'Take it off' is not the instructions.  Obviously I figured it out - if you have it on 'tight', you HAVE to pull it just a bit tighter to be able to use the release button/lever on the bottom of the buckle.  The instructions also don't tell you how to trim the belt to length. It's a simple matter of removing the buckle and cutting the belt, but... I didn't realize how much of the belt HAS to stick out of the buckle for the first ratchet.  I added a photo of the belt at the first ratchet.  If I gain much weight, I'll have to buy another belt!!
Also; the end of the belt that sticks out is embossed with an apple logo and "oxiguo".. Dunno wut that means.  I added a pic of that too.
I like that you can mix and match belts and buckles.
The belt came with a 15% discount code for buying more, but it's for buying from them, not from Amazon.
summary: Good belt, not so good instructions

reviewText:
I have had numerous instances of the inner-side of belt tearing/ripping where the prongs grasp onto the leather.  Upon each occasion, I must cut 1/2" off the belt and reattach.  The leather quality appears sub-par and unable to stand to normal use.

I would look into the other ratchet belt manufacturers who may offer a full-grain/more sturdy leather strap.  Maybe I'll get lucky and find one to use my buckle on.
summary: Leather consistently rips free from buckle.

reviewText:
I bought one of these belts a while back because an acquaintance had bought the Mission Belt after seeing them on The Shark Tank television show, and raved about how much better the design was than a traditional belt. Well, I definitely agree. It's a great design, easy to adjust, holds tight all day, looks high class. My only real complaint with this particular brand is the belt cracked heavily on the inner area after less than 6 months which caused the belt to stretch and no longer stay tight throughout the day. I contacted Mooniva who told me that was not normal, and to their credit, they promptly sent a completely new belt. I was very impressed by the service and was optimistic it would last longer this time around. However the new belt is only a few months old and it already has started to crack on the inner surface. I'm tempted to contact them again but I don't want to feel like a freeloader. I don't believe at this point that I was just unlucky with this product. The leather is probably not up to par. My friend had his belt for many months prior to me getting the first one and all this time later his has not developed even a surface crack. I love the buckle choices with this brand so I hate to think I might switch to Mission which has more limited styles. Also the customer service is top notch. Perhaps I could use the Mooniva buckle with the Mission belt.

UPDATE 11/29/16: As I was leaving the house this afternoon the buckle detached from the belt. It ripped the leather where the prongs attach. I ended up cutting about a 1/2 inch off the end and re-attaching the buckle. The belt is not holding my pants up as well as it did when I posted the original review. I notice I have to readjust my pants/belt at least a few times a day now where as before it was rare if I adjusted it anytime other than sitting down after a big meal.
summary: Great Design, Tons of Buckle Styles, Top Notch Customer Service BUT.. Poor Belt Longevity!

reviewText: I love the look but quality leaves a lot to be desired, unfortunately. After only one week of using it on my trip, with just a wallet and a small camera inside, the long strap broke off. Sad, but I have to return it. Otherwise, it is a beautiful beautiful bag. Indeed, I did not expect such bad strap quality from such a good brand. I wanted to keep it but paying over 120 dollars for something that breaks so fast - I think it is not fair...

reviewText: Be careful with sizing! I ordered size 9 (expecting 39 European), but received size 40. Soles are firm and durable enough to wear outside. Slippers are wide enough in case if you have wide feet. I have high arches and they provide good arch support. You will have to wear them with socks though, because the insole is made of a cold material, not boiled wool. I currently own another model of Giesswein slippers and those are made from boiled wool inside and out. That's why I didn't exchange, but returned these slippers - not only because of the wrong size, but also because they are not warm enough for me even with socks.

I got the Gray-A1 in Large. It fits my bust area perfectly and is long and flowy. I'm short, only 5'2" and this is the perfect length for me (so if you're taller, it'll be higher on the legs for you) - it comes to about mid-ankle, a few inches off of the top of my feet. Color is white, black, and shades of gray. I'm not usually one for patterns, but this one just spoke to me - I love the diagonal stripes and diamonds that are in it. It also has this cool kind of -- I want to say braided, but that's not the word - thing going on with some gold links connected over the straps. The metal is cheap and very light, but it still looks attractive in this fashion. I used to wear maxis all the time when I was in my late teens, early twenties, but then got out of the habit. With this dress, I definitely want to try to start wearing them all the time again (of course, I have to wait until it gets warmer). The fabric is a good, and stretchy, but a little thin, so it's semi-transparent and would be even more so if there were strong lights around, so I may have to wear a slip or body suit (a body slimmer never hurts, right? ;)) under it or just say what the heck and wear it as is anyway!

I was given this maxi dress complimentary in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I just got this today. I do think it's so pretty and I'm still going to find a way to start it but the thing is,I ordered American medium and I got a large. The arms to which are knitted are kind of tight but it does look beautiful. The knit has great detail and I love the flare over my hands but the fabric is kind of rough. So between the tight fit of the arms and the roughness of the fabric it makes that part of the top  alittle uncomfortable but still wearable. That is why I docked one star. The other star is docked because I ordered a medium and I received a large and around the stomach/ torso area its super huge. I don't know right now if I should try to send it back, or just find a cute way to fix the shirt so it's wearable. I don't know yet really what to do...i wanted to wear this so bad, and the design and how it's made is beautiful. I just wish they would have sent me the right size. But by the tightness of the arms, a medium may not have fit my arms. Btw I'm 115 pounds and 5'4 in height so my arms are far from big. But maybe they just make the arms a bit smaller so they fit snug against your skin. If that's the case I'd love to have a medium torso with the larges arms lol. The bottom part, to which is knitted to, is long and pretty as well. The fit does have a different look from the picture here on amazon but other then that it looks like the picture. It came in a outer plastic shipping package and inside the shirt was wrapped in another see thru plastic bag, so it was packaged good. And like I said it came pretty fast. It's exceptional for the price and for all the people out there that say why are you complaining about anything if you still got a pretty wearable shirt for 3/4 $, first off that's still money, money I could have put on something else money that I earned, so i deserve to get what I ordered and I want to be completely honest to help other people. So any ways if I did get the size I wanted, I would have only dedicated a half of a star for the snugness and rough fabric of the arms. I have bought another item from theses same people/company but it has not arrived yet, it's a small dress/swimsuit cover. I REALLY hope it comes in a medium. So as of right now I would order from them agin, I would just write them and make it clear what size needs to be sent, or send them my measurements so they could suggest and send the right size..i LOVE the price, I love how good it was shipped,I love that it was packaged good, I love the way the shirt looks and the design of the knitted parts. I just hate that they sent me the wrong size.. So far I would recommend but that may change after I receive my other product..

Hoping it'll hold up well in the wash. It does feel a little weird on because of the lining. Not sure if it's the fit or the material, but it's not a big deal. Also not sure if I'll wear it with a shirt tucked in to the waistband or not, as it does make everything kind of shapeless from the waistband down since it's just gathered squares of fabric with an elastic waist.

In any case, bought this for a Pam Poovey cosplay and expecting to work out fine. Can't complain for $10.

For reference, I am 5'2, 130lb.

Okay...so I got this in the mail today.  I have had a good amount of experience with leather, having worked in a leather shop off and on for many years.
I picked up the envelope it came in, and I immediately noticed how light it was (not a good sign).  When I opened it and touched the leather, I initially thought 'oh...this is made in Pakistan crap', but I could not find a 'Made In...' label anywhere on the vest, which is unusual.  There was also nothing indicating that this is any kind of licensed product (not a big surprise).
It does seem to run a little small, so if you order one, be sure to give them your measurements.
There is a lining and interior pockets which is a mark in it's favor.
The zippers are NOT heavy duty, and the center zipper is on the opposite side from most men's clothing.  This often indicates cheap foreign construction (but not always, so take that with a grain of salt).
The strap on the back is somewhat different from the one pictured here.
All in all, this is a few degrees better than an average Halloween/cosplay piece, and it looks good, but it Is several degrees less than anything 'Harley Davidson' would put their name on.
Worth the money?  I'll leave that decision to you because it truly depends on what you're looking for.

The packaging does not lend itself to sending it as a gift. It came wrapped in plastic, that's it. The sandal is cute, but made with those super cheap beads and the ring has the string sticking out where it was tied off (see the attached picture). Simple attention to detail/quality control and this could easily have been avoided.

I give this item 3 stars because it's cute. I'm taking stars away because of packaging, quality control, truth in advertising, and comparison with similar items sold on Amazon.

reviewText: Fits very nice, the sleeves could be just an inch or two longer though.

Pertinent information for anyone interested in buying this.

1) This item is both small AND slim fitting, so effectively about two sizes small. I got one size larger and, in retrospect, should have gotten two sizes larger.

2) The exterior fabric is not very thick. It's fine, but not a winter coat. Would make a nice autumn coat. I have the Match Men's pea coat which is thicker and much better for winter. Look to this one for a fashionable autumn coat.

3) There is NO inside pocket, and the exterior button pocket is microscopic and could only fit perhaps a key ring with 3 keys or less. Will not fit a small money clip or even an ID Card or whatnot. Small.

4) Even though the jacket is small and slim fitting, the neck guard when the jack is fully buttoned is way too big. The chest is slim fitting up to there and then all of the sudden it is just loose and extends about an extra two inches forward (mind that the neck goes inward, not outward!). It looks very strange.

Ultimately, not a bad coat, certainly not for the money, but it is A) NOT a winter coat, just a fashionable autumn coat and B) you need to take some considerations as to sizing and utility before you purchase. It is very small and slim and won't have much storage either.

I followed the chart in sizes. I'm 5'10" weighing at 170lb and am usually a medium on most things if not a large. I followed the chart and got an XL. And when I received it the jacket was okay. The material on it is soft and does not have that quality. Well it has that cheap quality to it. Not bad for how much it's worth though. It's a little loose on me though. Kinda wish I ordered a size smaller but I can fit a suit under it or something of that nature under it.

Also it took about two weeks for this to come over the mail. And this jacket is also the same jacket in one of the other selections on here that has "prime" labeled on it but is about $20ish more expensive. I just ordered this and had patience to wait in the mail and got it within two weeks.

Haven't worn it outside yet to fully test it but have worn it indoors though. It's not as fitted as I thought. The shape is more square

The photos are careful to keep the model in motion, or posed so that you see the pretty side ruffle, rather than the odd, hideous opening in the front and back. It is not a sexy slit, but a wide, awkward opening that is very out of place. It is almost as if the bottom of the dress was sewn on with the sides at the front and back. The color is perfect. UPDATE: The company that sells this lovely top is very reputable since they contacted me wanting to make me (the buyer) a happy buyer. They are darker than other amber lenses I have, so I always get the sense that the colors are filtered (greens look blue, blues look black, etc).  Lighter amber lenses feel more like true colors and contrast is being represented to me.  Other than that, lenses appear to have no distortion, build quality is good for glasses at this price point.
As great as the last pair I had.  The last pair lasted over 7 years got sat on so got new pair.

reviewText: great pair of shades

Always looking for stylish blue blockers and these are pretty terrific! Frame is sturdy and a bit over-sized. Very comfortable fit around the nose and behind the ears as well. The shape is somewhat like wayfarers, but more squared off making them look a bit sporty to me. As far as the lens, they are yellow/brown and much darker than expected, but no biggie. I will definitely use them as is. One day I used them when it was raining and they actually cleared up the view so much, I was really surprised!
Overall, these are a great pair of sunglasses to cancel out blue tones and the glare is reduced to a minimum~

Best regards,
-Reighven

reviewText: Excellent quality
Every thing I was looking for and even better looking in person

I am a server for a busy diner in town.  The "Riverside" by LEABAGS has made keeping my money and shift receipts so much easier.  Before trying this out I had simply been keeping my bills, coins and receipts in my pockets.  I never thought that there was a product like this that could help keep me organized while keeping my money safe.  It is made of 100% high quality leather so it is very strong and durable.  It came with a holster and chain so that I can secure it tightly to my belt or apron, and don't have to worry about losing it.  There are 9 compartments...plenty of places for me to stash everything I need for my shift.  Since using this I have not had to take so much time at the end of my shift to cash out and it is so much easier to make change for my customers.  I love this and would recommend it to anyone in the service industry or to anyone that needs lots of space in a wallet to help organize.  I purchased this at a discount for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a very nice, high quality professional bag for waiters or waitresses. I am a waitress and I was looking for a better way of carrying the money I have to turn in at the end of my shift without loosing the money I collected during the shift. This has helped so much. This simply has two in one. The larger part is the holster that will hold the wallet part. Both are attached by a very high durable chain. This is a genuine leather set as well. There is one slot that will allow you to separate the money, kind of like a wallet, then the other part you can attach to your attire to allow the freedom of not dropping the wallet part like I always seem to do. I couldn't be more impressed with this product. I purchased this at a discounted rate for my honest and unbiased opinion. I can honestly say I am very pleased with this product. I have been using this for a month now and not one dollar has been lost or misplaced. This is a high quality product, with no ripping or tearing, not even looking like it has been used at all here a month later. Honestly the best and highest quality professional waitress item I have ever used!
summary: This works great! Have not lost one penny!

Really happy with this purchase. Color (deep red) as pictured, size is as I expected, and canvas is nice and thick.

Random info to fill in the blanks:

 Opening seems slightly smaller than bottom width.
 Cross-body strap is on those swively clips, so it untangles itself automatically. Also removable.
 Two sets of handles?!! One set for carrying on shoulder, one set for by hand (which doesn't get in the way when not in use). I didn't notice this when checking out the product and am delighted.
 Side pockets, also unanticipated, are wide and deep enough to hold a water bottle or mini umbrella.
 The space between two inner zippered pockets is connected to make a tray-like pocket (it's quite wide, not flush with the side) that will let you keep important things at hand rather than buried in with the rest of your stuff; in my photo, it's a pill casethe one with white/gray sides and a blue strap around one side. FYI I have tiny hands.

Some folks have discussed quality issues, but this thing seems fairly sturdy.

Sure, over time I could see the zippers getting messed up, the zipper pulls snapped off, the cross-body strap clips broken, or the lining ripped (although it's thicker than most, it doesn't seem super durable)it's not the highest quality stuff.

But the core bag and attached straps? They're solid as heck, and I think a little flexibility and sewing skills will be enough to make this bag last for years.
summary: Exactly what I needed + pleasant surprises!

To remedy this, I use the Bundle Monster Anti-Slip Extra Grip Gloves in both my Pure Barre and Yoga classes. I originally had a pair from another brand that I loved and, devastatingly, lost one hand. I purchased these because they looked similar and were offered for a great price. The grip seems to hold just as well, but the wrist area is a bit larger for a smaller woman. I really really want to like these sunglasses - but I don't.  I like the style and way they look, but they are actually terrible sunglasses.  If you want a face ornament to make a fashion statement, then these will be find.  If you want something to block the sun, look elsewhere.

Pros:
1.  They are inexpensive and cool looking.  They definitely make a statement.

Cons:
1.  They are shockingly terrible sunglasses.  They flatten the light so it's difficult to see - Skiers and Snowboarders will understand the 'flat light' reference.  They turn a bright, high contrast environment into a low contrast mess.

2.  They are way too small for the average face.  They start to give me a headache after a short period of time.  A skinny 12 year old would say they are the perfect size.

I have no idea about how durable they are because wearing them is unbearable.

I was a bit leery about buying this model because I've had some bad experiences with a "nice" Timex model in the past. However, I also own 5 Timex models that work just fine. This is one of the finest Timex watches I've seen. The case is thick, solid and heavy. The crystal is also thick and haws a unique edge. The precise and hackable skinny second hand literally stretches to the numeric limits, indicating with a bright red arrow pointer. The only luminous parts are the two main hands. But, the beautiful blue Indiglo backlight takes care of that issue. The crown is large and easy to use. It feels and looks upper-class, if that's even possible. The case can't seem to decide if it's polished or brushed, seemingly being a bit in-between both. Another mention of the case's thickness, because it includes one thickness of the band, really sticks out far from the wrist a good 12mm. I have an 8-1/2" wrist, and I'm using the third hole from the end on the band. It's a very comfortable watch to wear. The band is very soft and pliable. The clasp and keepers look titanium, but I'm sure they're just brushed steel, not matching the smooth-edged bezel (which is polished stainless steel), but does match the edge of the case and crown tip. 20mm wide band, clasp and lugs. CR2016 battery.
summary: Amazing price for such a fine watch. Obvious quality throughout. Heavy thick case. Super soft calfskin band.

Great addition to me bow tie collection.
A beautiful bow tie and pocket square set.

I want to preface this review with... I am a bow-tie junkie. I have quite a few (50+) bow-tie within my collection. What that said...

I found this brand while searching for new colors and designs for a cruise in the Caribbean. I wanted unique colors and patterns that would work well for both formal evenings as well as normal casual dinners. I was also looking for good material that would hold the correct shape, while being easy to tie and untie as some materials are stiff or cause friction against itself. These little beauties are GREAT. They tie easily, have a wonderful look and have great color choices. Best of all they also come with pocket squares which in some cases would normally be the same price as the tie itself. Having the matching pocket square for the jacket makes all the difference in the world.

If you are looking to either have just one bow-tie for a special event, several to add to your collection for lots to build a collection I certainly recommend these as they will not break the pocketbook and will last a long long time through wear after wear.

If you have never tried a bow-tie I HIGHLY suggest it as it is such as classy statement with a nice suit, or even with a button up and jeans. They are great for most occasions and have the added bonus of not getting in the way when eating, drinking and therefore do not have the hazard of having food dripped, dropped or dragged across them.

Cute top-fairly sheer in daylight though...which I fount out the hard way haha. I usually wear a medium (6-8), but I ordered a large because I didn't quite trust their sizing and I figured it'd look good sort of blousy and baggy anyway. This dress fits as expected - especially if you look at the sizing charts provided by this company, not the one provided by Amazon.  The Amazon one is very wrong. The dimensions provided in Jiqiuguer's sizing chart are very accurate, and you will not be surprised by how something fits.  I am 5'3" tall, weigh 135 pounds,  and purchased the size small.  It fits fabulously.  It is loose and flowing, and extremely comfortable.  It is big on me, but that is the style of the clothing, and is exactly why I purchase it.

  I have purchased many, many garments from this company, and can tell you, in all honesty, that these are some of the best garments I have ever purchased. Everything is made of the highest quality fabric, and is assembled with care.  Seriously, I have never even found a loose string on these clothes.  The stitching is beautifully done, and the fabric is of a good, quality weight.

One of the things I really like about this dress is the neat detail down the front of the dress.  The darker blue with the stitched on strips of the lighter blue really stand out, and add interest and fun to this dress!  It is a nice light fabric for the summer months (but not cheap fabric), and the fact that it hangs wide is going to be so comfortable in the heat!

With all of these clothes from this company, I hand wash, gentle wash, or spot clean, to make  them last longer.  These are expensive, and I want to take good care of them!

reviewText: I ordered these necklaces in all colors available (although, not from one seller).  The price is so good, I couldn't resist!  I have worn most of the colors with outfits that matched the color necklaces.  All of them are striking and I received many compliments.  The center stone is just the right size; great color and the "peacock's" sparkling stones line one side of the ornament giving it a nice touch of glitter.  The necklace itself is a rope-type intertwined with gold beads and has a short extension.  Length of necklace is almost choker style so if you want the ornament to hang lower, you may need a longer necklace to give you the effect you want.  In all, a beautiful piece of jewelry and so affordable.  Glad to have these in all colors.
summary: BEAUTIFUL NECKLACES AVAILABLE IN MANY COLORS

Such a good belt with low price.

100 years ago the fly's on men's pants were fastened with buttons.  Then the zipper changed all that.  Most belts now require a fastener into one of several holes for best fit.  The problem is that every time the belt is fastened, it needs to be flexed back and tensioned in an unnatural state.  Eventually the belt wears out because of all that crimping and tension.  This belt eliminates the holes along with regular belt fastening issues.  Fastening with this belt is very straightforward, smooth & zipper like, with even a zip like feel & sound.  Tightness is adjusted in fractions of an inch. The design appears to be quite solid, but time will tell if these belts will hold up.

This is an ingenious buckle design.  I go up and down in my waist size and this belt is great for multiple sizes.  Also, on days that I tuck a shirt into my pants, my size changes just a little and this belt keeps my pants comfortable.  I would prefer a little thicker leather (the reason I didn't give it 5 stars), but the price and quality of the belt and buckle have been great.  I have purchased belts for myself and as gifts for family members and we have all been very happy with them.
I purchased this belt as a Christmas gift for my husband.  He LOVES it!  We will be buying others soon.

reviewText: Like many, I got tired of the typical belt where I need to make new holes (to account for BAU waist line fluctuations) and decided to look for alternatives. reviewText: Really amazing belt

This review represents my first- or second-impression after having only worn the belt twice, so I cannot speak to how well it lasts.

That being said, I'm initially quite pleased with it. The initial adjustment was easy. After cutting it to length, the teeth locked in securely to the cut end of the belt. The ratcheting end works properly and holds the belt in place with no slipping so far. The lever for unlatching it is on the bottom and not really visible, so it does not detract from the looks. The brushed stainless buckle came with a pull-off plastic covering, and so there are no marks on it. I like the appearance of the buckle's black center with the stainless surround. This should work quite well as an everyday belt for working in the office.

reviewText: This is a terrible product, has a very strong sickening chemical smell (I couldn't even leave the purse in the house while waiting to pack it up for return), has awful zippers that are difficult to operate (cheap quality), & weighs a ton. I'm almost positive this is essentially the same purse as other very similar ones I tried that had different "brand names." They all had the same material inside & out, same zippers, same terrible quality and stink. There were very slight differences in things like the strap buckles, different colors. They all have the same leather "badge" on the inside that shows up in photos on the product page with the particular brand name stamped on it. In all of the similar (but different "brand") purses I bought, that leather "badge" was blank. They came with labels (not on purse itself) with Chinese writing. I'm pretty sure the purses by ILISHOP, BAIGIO, and COOLCY are all the same mfg, and I *think* MAYBE others, such as Heshe and BOSTANTEN and possibly others are, too.

Very useful measurement tool, especially useful since jewelry does not always run true to size. Surprising how much variance this thing found (which explained some problems that I have had). Makes sorting very easy. Gauge size on one side, millimeters on the other. Seems accurate as long as you follow the instructions in the excellent review from another user. summary: Good useful tool for measuring the gauge of jewelry

reviewText: I have a box full of different size rings, this makes it so much easier to sort them for what I want. I almost sent jewelry back because I believed they sent the wrong size.

These baby flower headbands are awesome and beautiful!

Pros:
+bright colors
+variety of styles
+several shades of pink
+high quality elastic headbands
+handmade quality
+super cute!

Cons:
-yellow and turquoise elastic headbands do not exactly match the embellishments...see attached photos
-there were some glue strings present on the embellishments when I opened the package...they were very easy to remove (I would recommend shipping these to yourself first if you're giving them as a gift, as you'll want to make sure there aren't any glue strings present)

I highly recommend this product. Baby headbands are so expensive and I don't want to make my own. I'm delighted to have found these! I was given these at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion. All views expressed are 100% mine and 100% honest. Thanks for reading and I hope my review helps you.

Love, Love, Love these head bands and they are so much cuter in person.  The headbands are made with quality materials and seem to be put together well. So far they fit my 4 month old perfectly without leaving red marks.  They are all different but at least one matches her daily outfit.  The band has a lot of stretch and it seems they will last a few years. If my daughter does grow out of them I can cut them off the band and super glue the embellishment onto a clip instead. Beautifully made at a great cost!

I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review. I do not work for the seller or Amazon. I am just a mom who loves internet shopping and I rely heavily on other reviews for my purchases. For this I know how important my review is and if you feel it has been helpful please click "yes" so my review can help others. I also welcome and questions or comments. Happy shopping!

I am so in love with these Jastore Flower Headbands! They are precious!

These headbands are very well made. The headbands part of each one is made from a super soft, stretchy elastic. The embellishments are well attached to the headbands, I love that each headband is completely different from the others. One has a silk flower, another is made of chiffon. There are headbands with rosettes, flowers and even a bow.  The headbands are embellished all kinds of bling - from beads to sparkles. Each one of the nine super cute headbands are completely different.

The only thing I would suggest, is to be careful with these, when baby starts that phase where everything goes in her mouth. While the embelishments are securely fastened small fingers may be able to take them off the headbands - and thus prevent a choking hazard.

I bought these for my granddaughter. We will use them for photo shoots. If you are looking for some adorable headbands for photo shoots, you will not be dissapointed with these!

These are so cute! They fit loosely on my 4 month old's head. They stay put but she has plenty of room to grow. We have tons of basic bows but these add a nice variety of colors and shades that match a ton of her outfits. They did come out of the package with lots of hot glue strings on them, but it wasn't a big deal to go through an pick them off. They're well built, They feel like they will last, unlike some headbands I've gotten for her that were so poorly built, they would disintegrate almost immediately. These aren't like that. Some are a bit heavy in comparison to other headbands, but they still stay in place on my daughter's head, without leaving a red mark on her sensitive skin. They will be a staple in her wardrobe - some for special occasions, but there are a few I see her wearing with everyday clothes. Since they stretch quite easily, I anticipate using them through her first birthday.

I got these headbands at a discount in exchange for my honest review.
summary: Fits My 4 Month Old With Room To Grow!

reviewText:
I am the aunt of two baby girls.  When I saw these I knew I had to get them.  I love taking photos of them and these bows are perfect.  They are all beautiful.  The are made well and are much more ornate than many of the bows you can by in the stores.  I love that each one is different.  I know the days when my nieces are so small will pass quickly so I want as many beautiful photos as possible to preserve the memories.  I like that there are several different sizes, while the bands are stretchy they will fit a newborn as well as a 1 year old. reviewText:
For 10$ it was a fair buy. The material isn't extremely stretchable so it was a little difficult when getting off over a sunburn. A strap was also sewn on incorrectly so no matter what it has a twist in it- that part really disappointed me however I still wore it. The cup padding is a little odd, as its completely round and not oval like most suits come with. But the padding is easily removable and the suit is very easy to place in different ones.

I am 5'2" 125 lbs, I ordered a Medium and it's fairly snug. I am capable of wearing it however on my next purchase I will try a large. The top is fairly tight but not uncomfortable. The bottoms are definitely "low cut" in the front (a good 3-4" under my navel), and don't cover much cheek. I did get a lot of compliments on strap pattern, material pattern & color. I am of a athletic build and have hips/backside. Measurements -  34/26/37.

Overall it's worth the buy just make sure to get your sizes right. Not to mention it came on June 2nd, when it wasn't expected to arrive until July 7th.
Thanks!
summary: fair buy - check for you're correct size

reviewText: This is a darling dress that alas, looks way cuter on the model than on me, but then, the model is way cuter than me. Even so, it works pretty well for me, as a petite person. So often we are left swimming in these more voluminous styles, but that doesn't happen with this one. It is not as flattering for an 'apple' body type as it would be for a 'pear,' but it isn't bad either. The length is good and the color is pretty. I think I ordered the blue, but in some light, it appears more blue-green, which I like very much. It is also fully lined, which I wasn't expecting. The bottom layer is attached to the liner. This could be a good thing or a bad thing. It makes the dress more substantial. I bought it for an upcoming trip to the tropics, but may have to rethink using it there, as it may be a little bulkier for packing, harder to launder (really needs ironing after a wash), and not as cool. However, for the relatively cool area I live in, it will be a perfect summer dress. It did seem to run true to size. All in all, I like it very much.

This product shipped pretty slow. It arrived in about 3-4 weeks, in a plastic shipping bag than most clothing from here is shipped in. No rips, tears, or damages. I ordered a size L in the red color. The material is a bit thin, but not see through. It is almost exactly the same as spandex, but it was too tight. Not tight to where I couldn't get it over my body, it just showed every flaw which was a matter of preference on my part. I really want to order again in a size up, I know that I would love it, but Im planning on giving to my friend who is curvy size small.
summary: unless you want it to fit like a second layer of skin

It doesn't even hit my ankles. The whole thing feels cheaply and shoddily made: the lining is uneven and puckered, the ribbon button holes are already snagging and unraveling, and the neck and hemlines are both uneven. I thought this was so beautiful and classy, and I was hoping to wear it for my wedding. Honestly, I would be embarrassed for my future husband to see me in this dress. Extra star for the quick shipping and their return policy: I didn't have to send the dress back at all! They gave me a quick refund.

reviewText:
So Ive never given a 1 star review until now and its only because I couldn't give a zero star review
1. The picture is of a different shirt!  This is in no way a unisex shirt.  It is a women juniors at best.  The word layout is different.  The stitching is cheap with strings hanging off the hems.  If it was any thinner you could see your heartbeat through it.
2. The advertised soft cotton feels like dryer sheet chemical coated cheap fabric.  I had to wash it before trying in fear of exposing myself to anything banned by OSHA.
3. The fabric is so see through I could only wear this to a wet tee shirt contest but its so thin I wouldnt even have to get it wet
4. The sleeves don't stretch basically making your arms feel like sausages at your slightest moves.
I will try to return this shirt.  My fears are that since it shipped from China I am S.C.R.E.W.E.D.  I mean I buy $9 shirts at Target all the time and they are superior in everyway, shape, and form.  If I had to give this shirt a price it would be in the negitives.you would have to pay me to own this shirt.  This was a total let down!  I hope you can learn from my mistake.  I am ashamed to admit that I paid full price for this POS.  If you find this review helpful please let me know that I may of helped another human from making the same mistake by hitting the yes button below.
summary: Would maybe work for wet T-shirt contest...but may disintegrate in the meantime

reviewText:
This is my 2nd carry purse purchase, and I'm really happy with this bag!  The strap is soft, but very sturdy and well made, can be used for shoulder or cross-body carry.  The outside front pocket is great for keys, glasses, phone; those quick-access items.  I keep my ID, cash, and spare mag in the rear zippered pouch.  The inside of the purse is narrow but deep.
My favorite part is the weapons compartment.  It has zippered access from both sides of the purse, the zippers lock (keeps curious liitle fingers out of trouble).  The velcro-secured holster is firm and solid, not floppy, making it easy to slide the weapon into the holster within the purse.  I carry a Glock 19, it fits in this purse.
summary: Nice carry purse, sturdy, comfortable to carry, nice safety features built-in

For the price, I was expecting junk, and that's what I got.  The design on the dog tag was obviously applied with a laser, and the dark charred metal area will rub off like pencil lead.  Otherwise, a nice shiny stainless steel tag.  It might be best to order a blank one and have a professional engraver go to work on it.  the clasp that holds the tag to the chain is pure foil-like junk, and sharp enough to cut you.  I replaced it with the smaller, smoother ring that holds the keychain ring to the small bit of chain that comes with it.  Note, also, that this is a very thin gauge of neck chain that comes with it.  Probably not very sturdy, and nowhere near the thickness of military dog tag chain.  You get what you pay for, and I'm not complaining in that department.  My beef is with the shoddy laser work on the emblem.  Obviously zero quality control at the Beijing factory.

This dress is beautifully tailored and the material is light weight and of excellent quality. However the size options available are not suitable for people with a small bust and a not so small waist. I had to order several sizes up inorder to accommodate my waist measurements(32 inches) but the bust size that correlated to it was 39 inches( too big for me)
Whereas it fit perfectly at the waist for me, I had to make a lot of adjustments to the bust area inorder for it to fit. It didn't help that the dress came with padding at the bra area-the pads were of course large since that was the size they were stitched to accommodate. Since the fabric was lace and delicate, the adjustments had to be made very carefully.
I also did not like the heart shaped lining and opted to line it to the neckline-this was easily accomplished-I am very conservative when it comes to necklines and their linings therefore I opted for a higher neck lining(anyone who doesn't mind a lower neckline would be ok with this design)
Overall, I love this dress, its design(sleeves, fully lined, alternate lining under the original colours) and the classic black and white colours. The lace is absolutely gorgeous.
I recommend this to others, except for the adjustments needed. This is my first dress from everpretty and I was pleased with their service-they have a call number for returns/exchanges and they are efficient. I would order from this seller again should the need arise. It came well packaged, with no damage and minimal wrinkles.
I did notice that in general everpretty dresses don't accommodate an apple/pear shaped person. Don't know if the sellers can post a link/way to contact them for certain measurements for a more customized fitting. It would be worth it if they could.
Happy with my classy dress!
Nice for the price

So the dress is beautiful. However, it looks somewhat awkward up close - the lace on top looks fairly cheap. This was not my main problem with it though. The main thing was that I ordered according to the posted measurements, but the dress didn't fit. It was very large in the waist area, but much too tight in the chest area - so tight that I can't even wear it. I was disappointed, because I waited over a month to receive the item (but that's non-prime free shipping for you, oh well, can't complain about that), and when it got there, it didn't fit. I contacted the seller for a return to get my money back at least as the dress had never been worn, but I'm not sure at this point whether or not I will even return it, because even though I ordered according to the posted measurements which were wrong, I have to pay the return shipping. I don't think this is quite fair, as I don't have much money to spare. I might just try to give the dress away. Hopefully someone can get some use out of it.
summary: I wish it would have worked.

reviewText:
This jersey is a daily finite go! Good quality and the stitching is right on. I am in-between a large and XL (6-1' 192lbs) and I ordered a XXL. It is tight on me. So I'd you like your tops tight like leggings then this is the size for you otherwise I'd go up to the XXXL. All in all, I love the way it looks and wears. I didn't find it long in the back as another reviewer did, mine wears great! Will be ordering a couple more of these.
Update. Bought another jersey in the same colors, ok everybody loves it! And I do too. The fit is great, as described. Make sure you are honest with your size and order up in size! My 1st order was an XXL (USA =Lg.), like I said it was too tight on me for where I'm at in size and shape now, it felt like a compression under shirt. So I bought the XXXL and that fit like an US size Lg to XL a little looser but not too sloppy fitting. I wear a nike dry fit T-shirt underneith the XXXL for this cold weather riding and its perfect for the ride.
The XXL is on the left. They're just a good fitting jersey, and for the money and service you can't go wrong!

I am normally a US size large  6'3 175-180 lb and I ordered the XXL as per the sizing chart.  Make no mistake, what arrived is NOT anywhere near an "athletic" fit.  I would say the material is acceptable, but when zipped up, the fit bunches up along the zip line if you know what I mean.  Which brings me to my biggest gripe, the zipper.  As you can see in the picture, there is a normal zipper dangling around the neck area when the shirt is fully zipped.  What arrived is a big and bulky round zipper handle contraption that wobbles too and fro as you move (see pic).  Also, the zipper is on the left side although you wouldn't be able to tell in the pic.  This may not be a minus as I am not sure how other countries zippers operate to be honest.  It takes me a few tries to successfully zip the zipper when I put the jersey on.  Pretty bummed about this jersey not working out as I was planning on wearing it for a race tomorrow.  I will be returning it for a full refund.

I so so so wanted to love this.  I even paid extra for next day shipping because I needed it for a pool party last weekend and I thought it would look perfect with my new bathing suit.  I feel the picture on the model is VERY deceptive.  When looking at the picture it almost looks like a gorgeous exotic macrame hand tied rope design; however, when you zoom in on the picture of just the skirt (not the picture that the model is wearing) it is very grainy but you can see more of how the skirt is constructed.  The skirt design is more like pieces cut out to form the pattern not a beautiful hand tied looking design...or heck factory tied design....Also, the model in the picture must be VERY short.  I'm 5'3" with a 26" waist and 37" inch hips.....the skirt came to about my ankles unless I really pulled it down ( I certainly couldn't get the lovely to the floor look that the model is wearing)....I didn't have any issues with the sizing.  Truthfully, I would not recommend this cover-up.  I purchased one at our local grocery store on clearance for $7 and my husband couldn't stop raving about that one and with next day shipping this cost well over $25 and he didn't like it at all.  I really wanted to wear my cute white swim suit that didn't look right with my grocery store cover-up so I still wore this; however, definitely no compliments and nothing exotic looking about it at all.  Where I will still wear it because it "works" with my swimsuit, there certainly isn't any WOW factor or heck any factor for that mater...I will try and post pictures as that speaks volumes and maybe what I pictured seeing on the model is different than you see.  For me, I would not purchase again.

Not only was this dress much too large, it looked nothing like the picture and had many flaws. The first flaw I came across was the thick, paper feeling lace was incredibly wrinkled from the packaging, and even after an attempt to let it hang in a steamy room it was still bent in all kinds of crazy ways. The material was defiantly not capable of being heat treated, so I gave up trying. Second issue I noticed, was that the zipper was jammed half-way down the back. I fiddled around with it for about 5 minutes before I finally set it free to try on the dress. The dress had no elasticity in the torso what so ever, and the top half was straight cut and the skirt was a perfect triangle, making even the skirt look horrible. The dress was so scratchy and stiff, it felt like it was composed  hundreds of crumpled up paper balls. Once I got the dress on, I realized the button for the back was far to large for the tiny elastic it was meant to be slipped through, and the sleeves poofed up awkwardly on my shoulders from the high positioning of the arm elastic. The sewing was definitely not done properly, and there was many loose threads hanging from the dress. I'm 5'7" and 115lbs, and it hung off around my body in a way even a belt wouldn't fix. This is definitely a made in china knock off of another persons design, and even for $20 it was way overpriced for what you receive.

reviewText:
The paper backing came off the sticky portion without much fuss and I made sure I cut the tape not the backing so I always had a stub on the backing.  That made peeling the backing off super simple.

Used it on 3 cowboy hats, a couple of them I had to double the tape in areas on the hat but it looks like I could do at least another hat if not two.  Went from 7 1/4 hat size to 7 on two hats (doubled the thickness), 7 1/8 to 7 size on another.  A must have if you are going to order hats on-line since it appears there are some differences between manufacturers.
I have 2 amazing hats that would fly off of my head when I would wear them on the back of my head. This tape solved that problem and they fit great now!

I have a cowboy hat that just didn't fit my head right, and the wind would blow it off easily. This hat sizing tape solved my problem. The hat is more comfortable and it stays put.  As others have mentioned, to install, fold down the flap just inside the crown of the hat. Put the tape in the inside of the flap (in locations to accommodate the shape of your head - you might have to stack 2 or more layers of tape for larger gaps), and then fold the flap back into place. That way the tape won't move around and you have the smooth side of the leather band against your head.
summary: My hat fits better and stays put in the wind.

reviewText: Original

I couldn't get the paper off without shredding the foam. I returned it. I then went to the True Value and bought Weather Stripping of the same size (the paper came off easily and it works perfect; and it's less expensive). You could use this product even if you leave the paper on, but you'll likely be required to reposition it often. I didn't want to deal with that. But maybe that doesn't matter to you. Make your own choice. The product return went very smoothly and I have zero complaints about that.

Great product. Not sure why everyone saying the tape won't come off. Easiest way is don't take the tape off, take the foam off. Just grasp the end of the foam between your thumb and finger and squeeze it down until it separates from the tape. Just did 3 hats no waste. Worked perfect on felt and straw. The only down side is I'd like a little wider, maybe even double the width, couldn't find that option though.
great

reviewText: I have this belt in several different colors. They still look new after many wearings, are washable, and adjust easily.

I have been wearing these belts for years as I HATED the big bulge that showed under my clothes from most belt buckles.  This belt buckle is flat and pretty much inconspicuous.  And it is easily adjustable for a good fit around the waist.  The only downside is that after a few years the belt stretches out and  the adjustment for sizing eventually won't hold the belt tight enough.  But the positives far outweigh the negative for me.

Yaaay - This is THE most comfortable belt I've ever worn on top of being Vegan!!!  I bought the Seva model in the Eastern Taupe design/color - the the colors couldn't be better since I wear mainly olive, khaki or bone colored pants - it blends right in.  I am extremely sensitive to pressure against any part of my body but I need to keep my pants from falling down so have no choice but to wear a belt.  The webbing kind with the plastic click buckle have been my best bet up till now but are a bit narrow and have no stretch at all so when you sit or bend they put pressure on your stomach.  The thicker  wider military cotton webbing type with the open buckle you loop the webbing through then pull it back do the same thing - both are ok when you are walking and standing but when you sit or bend they cut into your mid section.  I put this baby on as soon as I got it - while standing in the parking lot of the market - I couldn't wait to give it a try.  I can't even tell I'm wearing a belt when I have it on. I usually wear cargo pants and this belts JUST fits through the loops - making it a little slow to switch from one pair of pants to another.  I'm going to buy the other model, Karma as it's a bit smaller - then I'll be covered for any and all.  Thank You Truth - Good Job!!!
summary: FANTASTIC!  LOVE IT!!  WANT ANOTHER IN A DIFFERENT COLOR & STYLE!!!  QUALITY - YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!

reviewText:
This watch is made in China and available at other web sites for $65 to $140.00. In no way is it worth $660.00. I have one and I paid $65.00 for it. I have not had the watch long enough to give it a fair rating, but I am grateful I did not pay more than I did. I was going to return the one that I have, but decided for the money I paid, it would be worth it to keep the watch just to see how long it lasts, and YES, it is the exact same watch available here for $660.00, verified by my research. I looked at Amazon first, before looking at other sites.

Please read the description carefully. It does not tell you where the watch is made, only that it has a Swiss movement. Swiss movements can be of fair quality up to the best high quality. The face of the watch says Swiss, not Swiss Made as is on all Swis made watches. The rear of the watch has no indication of watch features, as is typical of all Swiss watches and most other watches. There is no watch case included nor is there a manuel, only a cardboard box and a small sheet of paper that explains that the box is used to help preserve the environment and a Made in China sticker  on the bottom of the box. A box sleeve covers the sticker. There is also a small card that directes you to a web site for a users manuel, again to help preserve the environment.

There is so much bull about bull in the description that it really is difficult to determine exactly what you are buying. There is no way to verify the features of the watch, its origin, or quality. The only thing that can be verified by looking at the watch is that it is exactly as pictured, looks to be titanium, and is a Bull brand.

The back of the watch is stamped or engraved with the Bull name and logo, followed with the words "strong like bull". A typical Asian translation
of "strong like a bull," and yes, there is enough room to add the extra letter.

 Who knows, maybe the watch is okay. I tell things like they are.
summary: Swiss movements can be of fair quality up to the best high quality
